image.altText: A man looks ahead with a serious expression. Behind him is a wall of a brick house.

props.synopsis: A controversial church offered to settle with Mick Dover over his allegations of abuse, but only if he signed a NDA.

title.children: 'Not worth it, I'd rather tell you': Mick Dover turned down $1m to do this interview

image.altText: A man speaks with his hands to another man.

props.synopsis: A Gold Coast musician approached by a man he knew from a local bar went on to front a trading company, later accused of defrauding millions from ordinary Australian investors.Â

title.children: Musician turned 'CEO' confronted over investment fraud allegations

image.altText: Map of Australia on a globe.

props.synopsis: Immigration has become a new fault line inside the Liberal Party that will erupt again.

title.children: Some Liberals believe Australia is letting in the wrong immigrants

image.altText: A mugshot of a young caucasian man with brown hair

props.synopsis: Investigators are working to piece together why Tyler Robinson allegedly scaled a rooftop at Utah Valley University during an outdoor event and shot Mr Kirk in the neck at long range.

title.children: Alleged Kirk shooter Tyler Robinson 'not cooperating' with authorities

image.altText: Albanese at a press conference pointing towards the camera. He wears blue suit and pink tie.

props.synopsis: Australia's emissions reduction number is, in short, a laugh-or-cry-o-metre, or perhaps more accurately, a tax-o-metre.Â

title.children: Australia's emissions target is a laugh-or-cry-o-metre or maybe a tax-o-metre

props.synopsis: Unless Australia lifts its ambitions, its "fair share" of carbon emissions will be spent 14 years early. With the government announcing a 2035 climate target this week, how high should the government aim?

title.children: Australia has a carbon 'budget'. It's due to be spent by 2036

image.altText: Edan van Haren as a young boy smiling, wearing a striped T-shirt.

props.synopsis: Edan van Haren, a victim of child predator Maurice Van Ryn, says legal loopholes are allowing the confessed paedophile to protect his assets in superannuation to avoid paying compensation.

title.children: Paedophile declares bankruptcy to avoid paying $1.4m in damages to victim

image.altText: Dr Meg O'Connell takes a selfie in front of a grey plane on an ice shelf.

props.synopsis: Expeditioners at Australia's Antarctic stations are taking part in a research project to better understand the cognitive and physiological impacts of extended deployments â which can include actual "brain shrinkage".

title.children: Understanding 'brain shrink' at Antarctica could help astronauts

image.altText: The 'pass go' square on a monopoly game board.

props.synopsis: Political parties usually get in trouble for breaking their election promises. But what happens when they keep a promise that never actually existed?Â

title.children: SA government error in your favour â collect $1 million

image.altText: A white man and white woman sitting in a kitchen looking at the camera

props.synopsis: New report finds mothers do more of the sex education at home, raising concerns that young boys are missing out on key information from their dads.Â

title.children: Dads avoid sex talks with kids amid concern about online content

image.altText: A woman on a man's shoulders, both smiling, out the front of a stadium. She has an Aussie flag in hand, he has a yellow wig.

props.synopsis: Largely regarded as one of the most successful modern Olympics, years of work went into ensuring Sydney could fully capitalise on its moment in the spotlight.

title.children: How the 2000 Olympics changed the face of Sydney

image.altText: A man in a blue suit with black hair speaks into a microphone

props.synopsis: Kash Patel faces a clear test of whether he can convince the country that the FBI, under his watch, can avoid compounding its mistakes in a time of political violence and deepening distrust.

title.children: FBI director Patel to face Congress amid missteps on Kirk assassination

image.altText: Floodwater runs off road, side of road has slipped. People stand nearby to look at damage.

props.synopsis: Victorian councils say they are required to provide before-and-after photos of every 100 metres of road in order to be eligible for flood recovery funding.

title.children: Councils told to take before-and-after photos to beg for road funding

image.altText: A photo of a rectangular building wiith red bricks and many broken windows, on a grass surface with nearby bushes

props.synopsis: A retired nurse who worked at Moe Hospital says the closed facility could be used for housing rather than left to further rot.

title.children: Trashed former hospital site hits market after years of decay

image.altText: Sam Kerr smiles on the pitch after a Chelsea WSL game.

props.synopsis: Matildas star Sam Kerr scores her 100th goal for Chelsea just minutes after returning to the pitch for the Blues for her first game since 2023.

title.children: Sam Kerr notches century of goals in long-awaited return from injury

image.altText: A man leaning over to hug his bull arab dog, who has white fur, staring affectionately at man, with tongue slightly out.

props.synopsis: AÂ DarwinÂ animal shelter has been accused of "unprofessional" behaviour after failing to provide desexing services which new owners had already paid for as part of their adoption fee.

title.children: Pet re-homing charity labelled 'unprofessional' over failure to desex animals

image.altText: A woman is seen from behind and through some fabric hanigng out clothing on a washing line.

props.synopsis: As family violence survivor and mother-of-two, Maya was assessed as a high priority for social housing. Eight years later, she's finally moved into a suitable home in outer-suburban Melbourne, with vulnerable Victorians left waiting for years as the social housing waitlist soars.

title.children: Maya fled family violence, only to spend eight years in housing limbo

image.altText: A lady looking at the camera

props.synopsis: According to the Transport Workers' Union, some rideshare drivers have reported being on the road for up to 18 hours a day, swapping between multiple apps in order to bypass fatigue restrictions.

title.children: Rideshare drivers working up to 18 hours a day, union warns

image.altText: A camouflage officer looks at the entrance of a cave near Porepunkah

props.synopsis: New Zealand police briefly joined the search for alleged police killer Dezi Freeman as travel advice for Victoria's north-east eases.

title.children: Dezi Freeman search now Australia's largest tactical police deployment

image.altText: Jess Hull runs

props.synopsis: Jess Hull made light work of a rough semifinal to progress in the women's 1,500, but Linden Hall and Torrie Lewis both fell just short of making the final themselves.

title.children: 'Like dodgem cars': Jess Hull avoids chaos to reach 1,500 final

image.altText: A man celebrates after winning a rugby league match

props.synopsis: Brisbane and Canberra went to the great beyond in their golden point finals match and it was Reece Walsh who led the Broncos to the promised land.

title.children: Reece Walsh grabs the Sun to win the NRL's battle of ice and fire

image.altText: Terence Crawford celebrates with both arms aloft

props.synopsis: Terence Crawford is overcome with emotion after doing something no male boxer has done in the history of the sport, in front of over 70,000 fans.

title.children: Crawford creates boxing history after downing Canelo in front of record crowd

image.altText: Kangaroos players celebrate a high-five after a goal

props.synopsis: North Melbourne continues its blistering start to the AFLW season as Geelong and St Kilda also record big wins in Round 5.

title.children: Reigning AFLW premiers North flex muscles in grand final rematch

image.altText: A man looks out the window of a car. The car's interior is orange. The man is wearing a shirt with 'Versace' on the chest.

props.synopsis: Police believe the target of a shooting in Merrylands on Sunday no longer lives at the home but allegedly has links to a splintering Sydney crime family.

title.children: Former home of Sydney rapper shot at in drive-by

image.altText: Woman with dark hair and fringe wears jeans and purple sweater sitting with feet crossed in a bay window. Cushions beside her

props.synopsis: Kate Reid's Lune croissants have been called the world's best. But how did a young woman struggling with a near-fatal eating disorder end up perfecting pastry?

title.children: Kate Reid was in 'anorexic prison' when she created a world-famous croissant

image.altText: Raphael Collignon on his knees with his hands on his chest.

props.synopsis: Beligum's Raphael Collignon wore down late stand-in Aleksandar Vukic in the deciding rubber to lead Belgium to the quarter-finals.

title.children: Belgians break Australian hearts in Davis Cup classic

image.altText: Ricky Hatton standing in a boxing ring with boxing gloves on.

props.synopsis: The British boxer was a former world champion boxer and had been due to make a comeback in December this year.Â

title.children: Ricky Hatton, world champion boxer, dies at age 46

image.altText: A woman holds a toddler on her waist and looks at her with a smile

props.synopsis: A newborn baby was left in a Gaza hospital, the sole survivor of a deadly Israeli strike which killed her family. A couple who had struggled to have children of their own knew they had to provide her with a home.

title.children: Finding 'paradise' in the midst of devastating destruction

image.altText: protest groups

props.synopsis: Roughly 400 people, many wearing "Press" vests, were shining a light on the plight of media workers in the conflict.

title.children: Protesters gather at ABC in South Bank to mourn journalist deaths in Gaza

image.altText: close up of platypus head

props.synopsis: Anglers are urged to dispose of illegal fishing nets and stick with safer open-top traps, after two platypuses are found drowned in regional Victorian waterways.

title.children: Platypuses found dead in illegal fishing traps in regional Victoria

image.altText: PSPA area

props.synopsis: A Public Safety Preservation Act warning for parts of the Sunshine Coast has been lifted.Â

title.children: Police hunt for occupants of stolen vehicle near Sunshine Coast

image.altText: a ute in a river partially submerged

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian man has been rescued from the tray of a dual-cab ute found partially submerged in the Arthur River in the state's north-west on Saturday.

title.children: Swift water rescue of man trapped for hours on ute tray in remote Tasmanian river

image.altText: police arrest a man at sylvania during a child protection raid

props.synopsis: Eight men and one woman have been charged across with more than 30 online child abuse offences during a two-week child protection blitz.

title.children: Homes raided across NSW, nine charged with online child abuse offences

image.altText: A row of PNG soldiers in blue and green uniforms, holding their guns perpindicular to the ground.

props.synopsis: Australia is set to "totally integrate" its military with Papua New Guinea's forces, PNG's defence minister has said, as the two countries prepare to sign a landmark treaty.

title.children: 'Totally integrated': Australia to join military forces with PNG

image.altText: A crowd of Union Jack and Welsh flags.

props.synopsis: The march was organised by far-right activist Tommy Robinson while a counter protest by anti-racism campaigners also took place as the country continues to be dogged by the issue of immigration.Â

title.children: More than 100,000 anti-immigration protesters in UK amid scuffles with police
